worklogs.comment:
dvukolov commented on pull request #3286: ARROW-2038 [Python] Strip s3:// scheme in S3FSWrapper isdir() and isfile()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3286
 
 
   This fixes an exception from ParquetDataset arising when the supplied path contains the `s3://` scheme specifier. The issue stemmed from the fact that while the underlying S3FileSystem does support both types of paths, with and without and explicit `s3://`, its function calls always return paths stripped of the scheme. This messed up with the logic in isdir() and isfile().
   
   An alternative solution would be to strip the scheme in parquet.py (by adding it to _URI_STRIP_SCHEMES). This however would require additional code changes along the lines of:
   
   ```python
   _URI_STRIP_SCHEMES = ('hdfs', 's3')
   
   def _parse_uri(path):
       path = _stringify_path(path)
       parsed_uri = urlparse(path)
       if parsed_uri.scheme in _URI_STRIP_SCHEMES:
           scheme = '{0}://'.format(parsed_uri.scheme)
           path = parsed_uri.geturl().replace(scheme, '', 1)
           return path
       else:
           # ARROW-4073: On Windows returning the path with the scheme
           # stripped removes the drive letter, if any
           return path
   ```
   
   Not sure if that would have any impact on handling HDFS. Therefore this patch proposes a safer, more localised approach, already used in other parts of S3FSWrapper.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

dvukolov commented on pull request #3286: ARROW-2038: [Python] Strip s3:// scheme in S3FSWrapper isdir() and isfile()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3286#discussion_r245661214
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/filesystem.py
 ##########
 @@ -319,7 +319,7 @@ class S3FSWrapper(DaskFileSystem):
 
     @implements(FileSystem.isdir)
     def isdir(self, path):
-        path = _stringify_path(path)
+        path = _stringify_path(path).replace('s3://', '')
 
 Review comment:
   I agree. However, I am coming to think that this is a temporary solution at best. Current implementations of isdir() and isfile() will fail in a special case when both a file and a directory with the same name exist (which is totally legal in S3). A correct approach would take advantage of the underlying boto3 library. Might it make more sense to move these functions to s3fs instead and test them more rigorously there? Or are current implementations still needed?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

martindurant commented on issue #3286: ARROW-2038: [Python] Strip s3:// scheme in S3FSWrapper isdir() and isfile()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3286#issuecomment-452523411
 
 
   Here it is, s3fs as a derivative of fsspec: https://github.com/dask/s3fs/pull/161 . 
   The instances are pyarrow subclasses, and include the isfile/isdir methods, removing schemas, so you wouldn't need a wrapper class at all. In addition, the Dask open_files-like functionality is here and you can make mutable mappings at any path.
   I will not make a PR to arrow without discussion. One note: fsspec is py3-only. That could probably be fixed, but I don't personally have much enthusiasm for that.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [Python] Follow-up bug fixes for s3fs Parquet support

comments.body: [~jim.crist] [~cpcloud] [~xhochy] can we see if something needs to be fixed here for 0.9.0?
Moving this to 0.10.0, but please feel free to look sooner
Still would be great to harden our AWS support some
Does anyone want to put the S3 support through its paces before 0.12 goes out?

The issue stems from the fact that while the underlying S3FileSystem does support both types of paths, with and without and explicit {{s3://}}, its function calls always return paths stripped of the scheme. This messes up with the logic in S3FSWrapper.isdir() and .isfile(). A simple fix is in the following PR: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3286
